thorwin.math.geo

Class Triangle2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • thorwin.math.geo.Triangle2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class Triangle2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Triangle in 2-dimensional space

    • Method Detail

      • angle

        public static double angle(Vector2D p1,
                           Vector2D p2,
                           Vector2D p3)
        Calculates angle between three points. The returned value is defined as the angle between segment P1-p2 and P2-P3, in a clockwise direction. Returned values will be within [-PI, PI] where negative values indicate counter clockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        p1 - point 1
        p2 - point 2
        p3 - point 2
        Returns:
        angle in radians

      • angle

        public static double angle(double x1,
                           double y1,
                           double x2,
                           double y2,
                           double x3,
                           double y3)
        Calculates angle between three points. The returned value is defined as the angle between segment P1-p2 and P2-P3, in a clockwise direction. Returned values will be within [-PI, PI] where negative values indicate counter clockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of point 1
        y1 - y-coordinate of point 1
        x2 - x-coordinate of point 2
        y2 - y-coordinate of point 2
        x3 - x-coordinate of point 3
        y3 - y-coordinate of point 3
        Returns:
        angle in radians

      • ccw

        public static boolean ccw(Vector2D p1,
                          Vector2D p2,
                          Vector2D p3)
        Returns true if traversing P1 to P3 is counter clockwise
        Parameters:
        p1 - point 1
        p2 - point 2
        p3 - point 3
        Returns:
        true if counter clockwise

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(double x1,
                               double y1,
                               double x2,
                               double y2,
                               double x3,
                               double y3,
                               double x,
                               double y)
        Utility function for performing the contains function without having to allocate a triangle instance.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of point 1
        y1 - y-coordinate of point 1
        x2 - x-coordinate of point 2
        y2 - y-coordinate of point 2
        x3 - x-coordinate of point 3
        y3 - y-coordinate of point 3
        x - x-coordinate of the tested point
        y - y-coordinate of the tested point
        Returns:
        true if the point is contained in the triangle
